page.title: 18CHANGING TIMES IN HOUNSLOW.
page.content: In{1914}the shops in Hounslow were different.There were many small{family {shops,}a printing office and many public houses.Platts Stores,a grocers was one of the biggest.There weren't any {supermarkets.}We talked to an old lady called Mrs. Joan Willise.Her favourite shop was Bon Marche, a ladies underwear shop.Now there are no family shops left.Most shops belong to big groups and have names that can be seen in all High Streets e.g.Boots, W.H.Smith,Marks and Spencer,Woolworth. {Clothes}today are more comfortable and practical.{1914 }workmen wore three piece suits and women wore hobble skirts and blouses.Unlike today men and women always wore hats.Life was much simpler but there was a greater difference between rich and poor.Today {ordinary}people are{wealthier}and have expensive appliances in their homes.
